member.name: T:C1.Win.C1BarCode.BarDirectionEnum
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the barcode

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.BarDirectionEnum.Normal
member.summary: The barcode is rendered in the horizontal direction.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.BarDirectionEnum.Up
member.summary: The barcode is rendered from the bottom up.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.BarDirectionEnum.Down
member.summary: The barcode is rendered from the top down.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the type of barcode to be generated by the C1BarCode control.

remarks.para: The enumeration represents the different types of barcode that can be generated by the control.
Some types of barcode can be used to represent alphanumeric values, others can only represent numeric values.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.Code39
member.summary: Code 39 is an alpha-numeric encoding also known as 3 of 9 and LOGMARS. This was the first alphanumeric symbology developed, and is one of the most widely used encodings.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.Code93
member.summary: Code 93 is an alpha-numeric encoding that is slightly denser than code 39.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.Code128
member.summary: Code 128 is a very high density alpha-numeric bar code. It will use the least amount of space of any current 1-D symbology for symbols with 6 characters or more.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.CodeI2of5
member.summary: Code I2of5 is a numeric encoding. The symbol can be as long as necessary to store the encoded data.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar may encode 16 different characters (0 through 9 plus -$:/.+), plus an additional 4 start/stop characters (A through D). Codabar is used by some US blood banks, photo labs, and on FedEx air bills.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.PostNet
member.summary: PostNet is a numeric encoding used by the US postal service. It differs from most others in that it is based on the height of the bars rather than on their width.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.Ean13
member.summary: EAN-13 was implemented by the International Article Numbering Association (EAN) in Europe. EAN-13 encodes a 12-digit code that consists of a 2 digit system code followed by a 5 digit manufacturer code and a 5-digit product code. The 12-digit code is followed by a checksum digit (automatically added by the control).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.Ean8
member.summary: EAN-8 provides a short barcode for small packages. It encodes a 7-digit code that consists of a 2 or 3 digit system code followed by a 4 or 5 digit product code. The 7-digit code is followed by a checksum digit (automatically added by the control).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1BarCode.CodeTypeEnum.UpcA
member.summary: UPC-A is the common encoding you will find on virtually every consumer good on the shelves of your local supermarket, as well as books, magazines, and newspapers. It is similar to EAN-13, and encodes 11 digits of numeric data along with a trailing check digit. The first digit determines the number system, followed by a 5-digit manufacturer code, a 5-digit product code, and the check digit.

summary.para: UPC-E is a variation of UPC-A which allows for a more compact barcode by eliminating "extra" zeros. Since the resulting UPC-E barcode is about half the size as an UPC-A barcode, it is generally used on products with very small packaging.
When using the UpcE encoding, set the Text property to an 11-digit string as if you were using the UpcA encoding.

Note that not all UpcA codes can be encoded in UpcE. If the manufacturer code ends with "000", "100", or "200", the product number must be <= 900. If the manufacturer code ends with "00" but not with "100", "200", or "300", then the product number must be <= 90. If the manufacturer code ends with "0" but not with "00", then the product number must be <= 9. If the manufacturer code does not end with "0", then the product number must be between 5 and 9.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode
member.summary: Creates barcode representations of alphanumeric values.

remarks.para: To use the C1BarCode control, set the property to the type of encoding you want to use, then set the property to the value you want to encode.
The control will show the barcode image. If you want to include the barcode in a document, use the property to retrieve a resolution-independent image of the barcode.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for the control.
member.remarks: The background color only applies to the control. The barcode image that is available through the property always has a transparent background.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color for the control.
member.remarks: The foreground color applies to the control and also to the barcode image that is available through the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the Font used to display the value of the Text property.
member.remarks: If the property is set to true, then the value of the property is displayed centered along the bottom of the barcode image using the given font.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.ShowText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the value of the Text property should be displayed along with the barcode image.
member.remarks: By default, the control will show only the barcode image. To include a textual representation of the value in the property, set the property to True and set the property to the Font to be used for the textual display.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is encoded as a barcode image.

remarks.para: Some encodings support alpha-numeric values of any length. Others are limited to numeric values or to a specific set of characters. See the enumeration for details.
If you use characters that are invalid for the current encoding, the control will display a blank image.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.CodeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of encoding to use when generating the barcode image.
member.remarks: The selected encoding is applied to the value stored in the property to generate the barcode image displayed in the control. The barcode image is also available through the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.BarNarrow
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the narrow bars in screen pixels.
member.remarks: By default, narrow bars are one screen pixel wide (1/96") and wide bars are two pixels wide (1/96"). You should never have to change these values, they are exposed only in case you need to make adjustments for special barcode reader hardware.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.BarWide
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the wide bars in screen pixels.
member.remarks: By default, narrow bars are one screen pixel wide (1/96") and wide bars are two pixels wide (1/96"). You should never have to change these values, they are exposed only in case you need to make adjustments for special barcode reader hardware.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.BarHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the bars in screen pixels.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.SizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets how the barcode image is displayed within the control.

remarks.para: This property only affects how the barcode is displayed within the control. It has no effect on the actual barcode image, as returned by the property.
In most applications, you will either center or left-align the barcode image within the control. Although stretching the image is possible, it may make it unreadable for some barcode readers.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.BarDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the barcode.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.Image
member.summary: Gets an image of the barcode that represents the value in the property, obtained using the encoding specified by the property.

remarks.para: The Image property returns a that can be inserted in reports and other documents. If the value stored in the property is invalid for the current encoding, the image returned is blank.

Although the barcode image returned by the control is scalable, the default size is optimal for common barcode readers. Keep in mind that if you stretch the image and make it very large or very small, it may become unreadable to some readers.
The metafile image has a transparent background and therefore cannot be easily converted to a solid-background bitmap. To obtain a image of the barcode, use the method instead.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.GetImage(System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Gets an image of the barcode that represents the value in the property, obtained using the encoding specified by the property.
member.param: An value that specifies the type of image to be created.
member.returns: An image of the barcode with the specified format.
member.remarks: The property can also be used to obtain an image of the barcode. However, it always returns a image of a pre-set size and with a transparent background. This method returns solid-background bitmaps.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.GetImage(System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an image of the barcode that represents the value in the property, obtained using the encoding specified by the property.
member.param: An value that specifies the type of image to be created.
The width of the image, in pixels.
The height of the image, in pixels.
member.returns: An image of the barcode with the specified format and dimensions.
member.remarks: The property can also be used to obtain an image of the barcode. However, it always returns a image of a pre-set size and with a transparent background. This method returns solid-background bitmaps.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.EncodingException
member.summary: Gets the that prevented the from being encoded.

remarks.para: Most encodings have limitations that determine what type of text it can represent. For example, some are numeric-only and some require text of a specific length.
If the value of the property cannot be represented using the current , then no bar code will be generated and the control will remain blank.
In this case, the EncodingException property returns details about the exception that prevented the bar code from being generated.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode
member.summary: Creates QR barcode representations of alphanumeric values.

remarks.para: To use the C1QRCode control, simply set the property to the value you want to encode.
The control will show the QR image. If you want to include the QR image in a document, use the property to retrieve an image of the barcode.
The QR (Quick Response) format is one of the most popular 2D barcode formats today, with free readers available for virtually all smart phones.

The main reasons for the popularity of the QR format are its efficiency (it is very compact), flexibility (you don't need special scanners to read it), and the fact that the original developer of the format (the DENSO-WAVE company) made it an open and freely available standard (ISO/IEC18004 and others).
For details on the QR format, please see: http://www.denso-wave.com/qrcode/qrstandard-e.html and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QR_code.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.CodeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the "version" of QR code to generate.

remarks.para: The QR specification includes 40 "versions" of QR codes. Higher versions consume more space and are able to encode more information.
The control can generate QR codes versions one through ten only, which allow encoding up to 652 digits, or 395 alphanumeric characters, or 271 bytes.
Set the property to zero (the default value) to automatically use the most compact version able to render the content specified in the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.ErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the error correction level used to create the QR code.

remarks.para: Higher levels of error correction add more redundant information to the QR code, making it more resistant to damage. Higher levels of error correction also reduce the amount of data that can be encoded in a given area.
The default value for this property is the lowest level, which produces the most compact QR codes.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to translate the content in the property into binary values to be encoded in the QR code.

remarks.para: More flexible encodings have lower capacity. The control can encode up to 652 digits, or 395 alphanumeric characters, or 271 bytes.
The default value for this property is , which causes the control to automatically select the most compact encoding that can be used based on the content specified in the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.SymbolSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size, in pixels, of the symbols used to build the QR image.

remarks.para: Larger values will result in larger images which consume more space but may be easier to for some scanners to read.
The default symbol size is three pixels, which usually represents a good compromise between size and readability.
This property must be set to values between 2 and 10.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for the control.
member.remarks: The background color only applies to the control. The barcode image that is available through the property always has a transparent background.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color for the control.
member.remarks: The foreground color applies to the control and also to the barcode image that is available through the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.SizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets how the barcode image is displayed within the control.

remarks.para: This property only affects how the barcode is displayed within the control. It has no effect on the actual barcode image, as returned by the property.
In most applications, you will either center or left-align the barcode image within the control. Although stretching the image is possible, it may make it unreadable for some barcode readers.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.Font
member.summary: Overridden to remove from property window.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1BarCode.C1QRCode.EncodingException
member.summary: Gets the that prevented the from being encoded.

remarks.para: The control can be used to encode up to 652 digits, or 395 alphanumeric characters (uppercase only), or 271 bytes.

If these limits are exceeded, or if any of the control properties is set to values that prevent the content of the property from being encoded, the control remains blank, and the property contains details that explain why the code could not be generated.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is encoded as a barcode image.

member.summary: Gets an image of the barcode that represents the value in the property.

remarks.para: The Image property returns a that can be inserted in reports and other documents. If the value stored in the property is invalid for the current encoding, the image returned is blank.

Although the barcode image returned by the control is scalable, the default size is optimal for common barcode readers. Keep in mind that if you stretch the image and make it very large or very small, it may become unreadable to some readers.
The metafile image has a transparent background and therefore cannot be easily converted to a solid-background bitmap. To obtain a image of the barcode, use the method instead.

member.summary: Returns ResourceStream for "official" resources that provided only by C1, typicallly those resources contains design-time strings. member.name: M:C1.Win.Localization.StringsManager.GetParentCulture(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the parent of the CultureInfo passed in. Differs from ci.Parent in that while ci can be equal to ci.Parent, this method it never returns the passed ci itself, rather it would return null. Also this function has special handling for chinese culture. Under NET2 it returns "zh" culture name for neutral "zh-Hans" and "zh-Hant" chinese cultures, under NET2 "zh" is not exists.
member.param: The culture name to get parent for.
member.returns: The parent of the culture info, or null.

member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.
So the solution is this:

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Nag(System.Type,C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Nag user by showing AboutBox with license information. Show it only once per day per assembly.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
object that contains information about the license.
Whether we're running at design or run time.

member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object.
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
Any valid C1 runtime key.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

where the runtime key will be stored.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.SafeLicenseContext
member.summary:
Provides a version of GetSavedLicenseKey that doesn't require special permissions.
The code was mostly copied from the .NET framework, but then changed in a few places to require fewer permissions (assembly name, file io, etc).
The main change is the use of a custom deserializer to read Hashtable objects instead of the original BinaryFormatter, which requires permissions.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1AboutNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to specify the product name shown on the About Box.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1AllowedCallerAttribute

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1ProductInfoAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to attach licensing/product information to assemblies.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.ProductLicense
member.summary:
Represents a license for a product (e.g. C1BarCode, C1Studio Enterprise).
Provides methods for: - generating new license keys (administrative task) - checking license key validity (used by installer and products) - generating and checking runtime keys (used by products) - installing/uninstalling licenses (used by installer)
The install/uninstall code requires elevated permissions, and is used only by setups and utilities (not by controls). The code is implemented in the ProductLicense.Installer.cs, which controls should not include since it won't be useful to them.
When a product is sold, we send the user a license KEY. The user installs a license on his machine by providing his name, his company name, and the key.
The is a string in the following format:
AAQYYCC-XX-NNNNNN-DD-DZZZZZZ
Where:
AA: Product code (should match one of the products in the product catalog (see ProductInformation.GetProductCatalog()). Q: Quarter when the license key was issued (1, 2, or 3) YY: Year when the license key was issued (e.g., 10 for 2010) CC: Order code, two chars that indicate whether this is a new sale, upgrade, renewal, special offer, etc. XX: Hash code to ensure key validity. NNNNNN: Unique serial number. DDD: Vendor code, three chars ZZZZZZ: Combination of random numbers for uniqueness and extra hash.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens an existing zip file stored in a stream.
member.param: that contains a zip file.

remarks.para: This method allows you to open and work with a zip file stored in a stream instead of in an actual file.
Typical usage scenarios for this are zip files stored as application resources or in binary database fields.

example.para: The example below loads information from a zip file stored in an embedded resource. To embed a zip file in an application, follow these steps:
1) Right-click the project node in Visual Studio, select the Add | Add Existing Item... menu option.
2) Select a zip file to add to the project as an embedded resource.
3) Select the newly added file and make sure the Build Action property is set to "Embedded Resource".

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to use when adding or retrieving entries from the zip file.

remarks.para: If the property is set to a non-empty string, any entries added to the zip file will be encrypted and protected by the password. To extract these entries later, the same password must be used.
The password applies to all entries from the moment it is set. If you set the password to a non-empty string and then add several entries to the zip file, all entries will use the same password.

Although C1Zip supports Unicode characters in passwords, several popular zip utilities do not. To ensure your encrypted zip files can be opened with third-party utilities, use passwords that consist of ASCII characters only.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.UseUtf8Encoding
member.summary: Determines whether file names and comments should be stored in UTF8 format.

remarks.para: The Zip specification does not specify what character encoding to be used for the embedded file names and comments. The original IBM PC character encoding set, commonly referred to as IBM Code Page 437, is supposed to be the only encoding supported. Because of this, some zip utilities will not allow storing file names or comments with Unicode characters. Others do allow it, but those file names and comments may not be read correctly by other utilities.

Setting the UseUtf8Encoding to true causes C1Zip to store and retrieve file names and comments using the Utf8 encoding, which allows Unicode characters. The caveat is that Unicode file names may not be read correctly by other zip utilities.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.OpenBatch
member.summary: Opens the zip file for multiple operations.

remarks.para: By default, opens and closes the zip file automatically whenever entries are added or removed.

This can cause delays in systems that have certain types of anti-virus software installed, or in situations where you want to add a large number of relatively small entries. In these cases, use the and methods to keep the zip file open until the entire operation is concluded.
Use a finally clause to ensure that the method is called even if an exception occurs.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.CloseBatch
member.summary: Closes a zip file after it was opened with a call to the method.
member.remarks: See the method for a complete description and a sample.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.MemoryThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the largest stream to be compressed in memory.

remarks.para: compresses entries into temporary streams before adding them to the zip file.
Entries with fewer than bytes are compressed using a temporary memory stream.
Entries with more than bytes are compressed using a temporary file. You can control the location of the temporary file using the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.TempFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the temporary file to use when adding entries to the zip file.
member.remarks: creates temporary streams while adding entries to a zip file. These temporary streams can be memory-based or disk-based, depending on the size of the entry and on the setting of the property. If a temporary file is used, you can control its location by setting the property. If you don't select a path for the temporary file, will create one automatically using the method.

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.ZipEncoding
member.summary:
Encoding used for entry names and comments
NOTE: this is culture-dependent, which is a really bad idea, but most zip packers use the default OEM code page to encode file names, so we have to go along with it...
Note that Encoding.Default seems like a logical choice but doesn't really work for international locales. Instead, we need to create an encoding using the current OEMCodePage. That allows accents and international characters to be used in file names (like the zip built into Windows, allows names such as "land.txt", "iti.txt", "Wrth.txt", etc.).
This has nothing to do with compression, it's just used to encode and decode entry names and comments.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the underlying compressed stream, decompressing them into a buffer, then advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Output stream that will contain the compressed data.
Specifies whether the compressed stream should be compatible with zip files.

remarks.para: Streams in zip files are different from regular zlib streams in two aspects:
(1) zip streams do not contain any local header information (the information is stored in the zip file headers instead) and
(2) zip streams use a CRC32 checksum instead of the adler32 checksum used by zlib streams.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: The fields and must be initialized before by the caller.

inflateInit does not perform any decompression apart from reading the zlib header if present: data decompression is done by the method. Therefore, the next_in and avail_in may be modified, but next_out and avail_out are unchanged.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.param: Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Decompresses as much data as possible until the input buffer is exhausted or the output buffer is full.
member.param: How to flush data into the output buffer (default value is 2).
member.returns: Z_OK if some progress has been made (more input processed or more output produced), Z_STREAM_END if the end of the compressed data has been reached and all uncompressed output has been produced, Z_NEED_DICT if a preset dictionary is needed at this point, Z_DATA_ERROR if the input data was corrupted (input stream not conforming to the zlib format or incorrect checksum), Z_STREAM_ERROR if the stream structure was inconsistent (for example if next_in or next_out was null), Z_MEM_ERROR if there was not enough memory, Z_BUF_ERROR if no progress is possible or if there was not enough room in the output buffer when Z_FINISH is used.

remarks.para: inflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Decompress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in is updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to inflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. inflate provides as much output as possible, until there is no more input data or no more space in the output buffer.

Before the call to inflate, the application should ensure that at least one of the actions is possible, by providing more input and/or consuming more output, and updating the next_* and avail_* values accordingly.
If inflate returns Zero and avail_out == 0, it must be called again after making room in the output buffer because there might be more output pending.
The application can consume the uncompressed output when it wants, for example when the output buffer is full (avail_out == 0), or after each call of inflate.
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSync
member.summary: Skips invalid compressed data until a full flush point is found, or until all available input is skipped. No output is provided.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the decompression dictionary from the given uncompressed byte sequence.
member.param: Data in the dictionary.
Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after a call of if this call returned Z_NEED_DICT. The dictionary chosen by the compressor can be determined from the Adler32 value returned by this call to inflate.
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see the method).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses as much data as possible, and stops when the input buffer becomes empty or the output buffer becomes full.
member.param: Non-zero to force some data to be flushed into the output buffer.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: deflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Compress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in and avail_in are updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to deflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. This action is forced if the parameter is non zero. Forcing flush frequently degrades the compression ratio, so this parameter should be set only when necessary (in interactive applications). Some output may be provided even if flush is not set
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.
If deflate returns with avail_out == 0, this method must be called again with the same value of the parameter and more output space until the flush is complete (deflate returns with avail_out != 0).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateParams(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dynamically updates the compression level and compression strategy.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Compression strategy (0-2).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the compression dictionary from the given byte sequence without producing any compressed output.
member.param: Data in the dictionary.
Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after , before any call to .
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see ).

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing
member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the ChartAnimation.Easing property.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseInCubic
member.summary: Cubic easing in. Begins at zero velocity and then accelerates.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutCubic
member.summary: Cubic easing in and out. Begins at full velocity and then decelerates to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseInOutCubic
member.summary: Cubic easing in and out. Begins at zero velocity, accelerates until halfway, and then decelerates to zero velocity again.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseInBack
member.summary: Back easing in. Starts slowly and then accelerates.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutBack
member.summary: Back easing out. Begins quickly and then decelerates.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutElastic
member.summary: Quintic easing out. Begins at full velocity and then decelerates to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutBounce
member.summary: Bouncing easing out. Begins quickly and then decelerates. The number of bounces is related to the duration: longer durations produce more bounces.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.ChartStyleFillType.RadialGradient
member.summary: Applies the radial gradient style fill to the chart.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType
member.summary: Represents the type of trendline series.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.Polynom
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 + C1*x + C2*x2 + : + Cn-1*xn-1, where n - number of terms.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.Exponent
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 * exp( C1*x)

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.Logarithmic
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 * ln(C1*x)

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.Power
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 * pow(x, C1)

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.Fourier
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 + C1 * cos(x) + C2 * sin(x) + C3 * cos(2*x) + C4 * sin(2*x) + ...

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.MinX
member.summary: Minimal X-value.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.MinY
member.summary: Minimal Y-value.

member.summary: Maximum X-value.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.MaxY
member.summary: Maximum Y-value.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.AverageX
member.summary: Average X-value.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.TrendlineFitType.AverageY
member.summary: Average Y-value.

member.summary: Draws a line chart.

member.summary: Draws an area chart.

member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the LineChart.FitType property.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.LineChartFitType.Line
member.summary: Straight lines connect data points.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.LineChartFitType.Spline
member.summary: Line passes smoothly through each data point; there are no sharp corners and no abrupt changes in the tightness of the curve.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Chart.LineChartFitType.Bezier
member.summary: Line does not pass through all data points, but the points act as magnets, pulling the curve in certain directions and influencing the way the curve bends.

members.member:
Array of dependencies.
In the array of dependencies each item can be one of the following:
- relative path to a resource. for .js path should be relative to C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.Resources.wijmo for .css path should be relative to C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.Resources.themes.wijmo Example: [WidgetDependencies("jquery.wijmo.wijcalendar.js"] [WidgetDependencies("jquery.wijmo.wijcalendar.css"]
- absolute path to a resource, in this case item should be prefixed with "@". Example: [WidgetDependencies("@C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.Resources.resource.js"]
- typeof(Extender) Example: [WidgetDependencies(typeof(CalendarExtender))]

member.summary: A value that specifies the height of the drop-down list. Default: 300. Type: Number.
member.remarks: If the total height of all items is less than the value of this option, it will use the total height of items as the height of the drop-down list.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBox.DropdownWidth
member.summary: A value that specifies the width of the drop-down list. Default: "-1". Type: Number.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.ISpellParser.GetNextWord(System.String,System.Int32,C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Method that retrieves the next word to spell-check in a string.
member.param: String that contains the text being spell-checked.
Position being checked within the string.
that specifies types of words that should be ignored.
Last word retrieved by the parser (used to detect duplicates).
member.returns: A object that represents the next word to be spell-checked, or null if all the text has been spell-checked.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.ISpellParser.FilterWord(System.String)
member.summary: Method that filters any unwanted characters out of a string to be checked.
member.param: Raw text to be checked.
member.returns: A modified word to be checked, null to skip checking this string, or the same word if no filtering is required.

remarks.para: This method is useful in custom parsers that should ignore specific characters or words.
For example, a parser that parses strings with accelerator characters should filter out the ampersands before the word is checked.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.BadWordEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this bad word should be ignored by the .

remarks.para: If the property is not null, then the error is about to be displayed in a spell dialog. Setting the Cancel parameter to true in this case causes the dialog to skip to the next error.

If the property is null, then the error was detected in as-you-type mode and the word is about to be underlined. Setting the Cancel parameter to true in this case prevents the word from being underlined.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent
member.summary: Component that provides spell-checking services to controls and applications.
member.remarks:
The C1SpelChecker component supports three spell-checking modes:
Batch mode Use the CheckText(string), CheckWord, and GetSuggestions(string, int) methods to check strings and get lists of errors and spelling suggestions.
Dialog mode Use the CheckControl(ISpellCheckableEditor method to check the content of any TextBoxBase-derived controls using a modal dialog. The C1SpellChecker will check the text and display a dialog where the user can choose to correct or ignore each error. You can also check editors that do not derive from TextBoxBase. To do that, you have to create a wrapper class that implements the ISpellCheckableEditor interface.
As-you-type mode Set the extender property SpellCheck on any TextBoxBase-derived control to true, and the C1SpellChecker will monitor changes to the control. Any spelling mistakes will be indicated on the control by a red, wavy underline; right-clicking the errors will show a context menu with spelling suggestions. You can also provide as-you-type spelling support for editors that do not derive from TextBoxBase. To do that, you have to create a wrapper class that implements the ISpellCheckableRichEditor interface.
Dictionary Deployment
The C1SpellChecker component uses spelling dictionaries stored in files with a 'dct' extension.
To select which dictionary to use, use the MainDictionary property and set SpellDictionaryBase.FileName to the name of the file you want to use.
The easiest way to ensure the dictionary is deployed correctly is to add to your projects a reference to the dictionary file(s) you want to use, then set the Build Action property to None and the Copy to Output Directory property to Copy if newer. This way, the dictionaries will be copied to the output directory along with the application executable and the C1SpellChecker assembly.
When using this deployment method, make sure the main dictionary's SpellDictionaryBase.FileName value specifies a file name without a path. This way, the component will search for the dictionary in the directory where the C1SpellChecker assembly is located.

member.remarks: Options available include types of words to ignore, whether to display suggestions in a context menu, the number of suggestions to display, and so on.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.MainDictionary
member.summary: Gets the main dictionary used for spell-checking.

remarks.para: This is the main dictionary. It is stored in a compressed format, and is read-only.

You can edit the spell dictionaries or create your own using the C1DictionaryEditor utility that ships with . This option can be useful for domain-specific applications that require the use of technical jargon (for example, medical, legal, and so on).
Users cannot add words to this dictionary, only to the .

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.UserDictionary
member.summary: Gets the user dictionary used for spell-checking.
member.remarks: This is the user dictionary. The user may add words to this dictionary using the spell-checking dialog, and it is automatically persisted to the specified file.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.CustomDictionary
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom spell-checking dictionary.
member.remarks: This property allows you to specify additional custom dictionaries to be used in addition to the standard and dictionaries.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.CustomParser
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom spell-checking parser.

remarks.para: This property allows you to specify a custom parser for breaking up text into words to be spell-checked.
For example, you may want to use a custom parser when checking source code files. This way you can spell-check the comments in the code and skip the actual code.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.IgnoreList
member.summary: Gets the list of words to ignore during spell-checking.

remarks.para: The list is used by the built-in spell dialog and by the as-you-type mechanism.
The user may add words to this list using the "Ignore All" button in the spell dialog or the "Ignore All" option in the as-you-type context menu.
Strings in the list are case-sensitive.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Editor.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellCheckerComponent.AutoReplaceList
member.summary: Gets a list of words and replacements to use while spell-checking.

remarks.para: This list is used by the built-in spell dialog and by the as-you-type mechanism.
The built-in spell dialog checks the list when it finds a misspelled word. If a match is found, the misspelled word is replaced with the corresponding list entry.
The as-you-type mechanism looks for matches whenever the user types a character that is not a letter or a digit. If a match is found, the text is replaced with the corresponding list entry.

Note the difference in operation between the two modes. In as-you-type spell-checking, any matches will be replaced, whether the key is spelled correctly or not. In dialog mode, keys that are spelled correctly will not be flagged as errors and therefore will not be replaced. For example, if the AutoReplaceList contains an entry with the strings ("attn.", "attention of"), then typing "attn. " into the editor will trigger a replacement and the editor will contain "attention of ". However, because "attn." is not a spelling error, the spell dialog will not replace instances of the string "attn." with "attention of".
The fires the event before making each automatic replacement. The event handler may cancel the replacement.
Strings in the list are case-sensitive.

member.summary: Event that fires when a spelling error is found by the C1SpellChecker.
member.remarks: This event fires when the component detects a spelling error in a control. This happens while a spell dialog is displayed (see the CheckControl(ISpellCheckableEditor method) or while the component is painting the red wavy underlines that mark misspelled words in dynamic mode (see the SetSpellChecking method). The event parameters have a Dialog property that allow the handler to determine whether a spell dialog is being displayed or not. The event parameters also have a Cancel property that can be used to ignore the error.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.Event.ParentRecurrenceId
member.summary: id of the event object that defines the recurrence criteria for this event object. If an event is recurring (see isRecurring) it represents an occurrence in the series that is started and defined by a specific pattern event. Use the getPatern method in order to obtain the pattern of the current event. A pattern event can be recognized by its recurrenceState field set to the "master" value. The recurrence information defined by the pattern event can be accessed via the recurrencePattern field of the event. If this event is a not member of a recurrence, or is itself a root event, this field will be null.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.Event.RecurrenceState
member.summary: Indicates the recurrence state of the event. (possible values are "notRecurring"(or null), "master", "occurrence", "exception", "removed")

member.summary: Represents the recurrence attributes of an event. Only master events can have this field (recurrenceState is "master")

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.ParentRecurrenceId
member.summary: Id of the event object which represents the master event for this RecurrencePattern object.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.RecurrenceType
member.summary: Determines the type of recurrence: daily - the recurring event reoccurs on a daily basis. workdays - the recurring event reoccurs every working day. monthly - the recurring event reoccurs on a monthly basis. monthlyNth - the recurring event reoccurs every N months. weekly - the recurring event reoccurs on a weekly basis. yearly - the recurring event reoccurs on an yearly basis. yearlyNth - the recurring event reoccurs every N years.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Specifies the interval between occurrences of the recurrence. The interval field works in conjunction with the "recurrenceType" field to determine the cycle of the recurrence. The maximum allowable value is 99 for weekly patterns and 999 for daily patterns. The default value is 1. For example, if the recurrenceType is set to daily, and the "interval" is set to 3, the recurrence will occur every third day.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.StartTime
member.summary: Indicates the start time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.EndTime
member.summary: Indicates the end time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.PatternStartDate
member.summary: Indicates the start date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.PatternEndDate
member.summary: Indicates the end date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.Occurrences
member.summary: The number of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. This field allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. The default value is 0. This field must be coordinated with other fields when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the "patternEndDate" field or the "occurrences" field is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the "noEndDate" field is false. If neither "patternEndDate" nor "occurrences" is set, the pattern is considered infinite and "noEndDate" is true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.Instance
member.summary: Determines the week in a month in which the event will occur. This field is only valid for recurrences of the "monthlyNth" and "yearlyNth" types and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The default value is "first". Possible values are: first - the recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the first week in the month. second - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the second week in the month. third = - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the third week in the month. fourth - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the fourth week in the month. last - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the last week in the month.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.DayOfWeekMask
member.summary: String, contains set of values representing the mask for week days on which the recurring event occurs. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. The default value is "none". When the "RecurrenceType" field is set to "daily", the "DayOfWeekMask" field can only be set to "everyDay"; setting the field to any other value will result in an exception. When the "recurrenceType" field is set to "workdays", the "dayOfWeekMask" field can only be set to "workDays"; setting the field to any other value will result in an exception. When the "recurrenceType" field is set to "weekly", the "dayOfWeekMask" field cannot be set to "none"; doing so will result in an exception being thrown. When the recurrenceType" field is set to "monthly" or "yearly" the "dayOfWeekMask" field is not applicable. Possible values are: none - no specific value. sunday - specifies Sunday. monday - Specifies Monday. tuesday - Specifies Tuesday. wednesday - Specifies Wednesday. thursday - Specifies Thursday. friday - Specifies Friday. saturday - Specifies Saturday. weekendDays - Specifies Saturday and Sunday. workDays - Specifies work days (all days except weekend). everyDay - Specifies every day of the week.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: The number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the recurrenceType field is set to "monthly" or "yearly". The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Number, indicates which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Can be a number from 1 to 12. This field is only valid for recurrence patterns whose recurrenceType" field is set to "yearlyNth" or "yearly". The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.NoEndDate
member.summary: Indicates if the recurrence pattern is endless. The default value is True. This field must be coordinated with other fields when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the patternEndDate field or the occurrences field is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the "noEndDate" field is false. If neither patternEndDate nor occurrences is set, the pattern is considered infinite and "noEndDate" is true.

member.summary: Holds the list of event object ids that define the exceptions to that series of events.

member.summary: Holds the list of event object's ids removed from that series of events.

member.summary: Determines the scrolling mode.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.ScrollingSettings.StaticColumnIndex
member.summary: Indicates the index of columns that will always be shown on the left when the grid is scrolled horizontally.
member.value: Default value is -1.
member.remarks: Note that all columns before the static column will be automatically marked as static too. It can only take effect when is not "None"/>. It will be considered as -1 in a hierarchical grid or when grouping or row merging is enabled. -1 means no data column but row header is static. 0 means one data column and row header are static.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.ScrollingSettings.StaticRowIndex
member.summary: Indicates the index of data rows that will always be shown on the top when the grid is scrolled vertically.
member.value: Default value is -1.
member.remarks: Note, that all rows before the static row will be automatically marked as static too. It can only take effect when is not "None"/>. It will be considered as -1 in a hierarchical grid or when grouping or row merging is enabled. -1 means no data row but header row is static. 0 means one data row and header row are static.

member.summary: Scrolling is not used.

member.summary: Scrollbars appear automatically depending upon content size.

member.summary: Horizontal scrollbar is active.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.ScrollMode.Vertical

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.VirtualizationMode
member.summary: Determines the virtualization mode.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.VirtualizationMode.None
member.summary: Virtual scrolling is not used.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.VirtualizationMode.Rows
member.summary: Rows are rendered on demand.

remarks.para: There are two modes of rows virtual scrolling determined by the property. The first one is static when all the data are available to the client but rows are rendered when scrolled. The second one is dynamic, set by the value. New portions of data are requested from server when need to be rendered.
Static mode cannot be used at the same time when paging, fixed rows or columns merging are used. Dynamic mode cannot work with columns grouping in addition.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.VirtualizationMode.Columns
member.summary: Columns are rendered on demand.
member.remarks: Cannot be used at the same time when grouping or band columns are used.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.VirtualizationMode.Both
member.summary: Both Rows and Columns modes are used.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.FreezingMode
member.summary: Determines the freezing mode.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.FreezingMode.None
member.summary: The freezing handle cannot be dragged.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.FreezingMode.Columns
member.summary: The user can drag the vertical freezing handle to change position of the static column.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.FreezingMode.Rows
member.summary: The user can drag the horizontal freezing handle to change position of the static row.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.FreezingMode.Both
member.summary: The user can drag both horizontal and vertical freezing handles.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.KeyActionEnum.MoveAcross

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.KeyActionEnum.MoveAcrossOut
member.summary: Same as MoveAcross, but move the focus to the next control in the tab order when the last cell in the grid is reached.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.OnClientAfterCellEdit
member.summary: A function called after editing is completed.
member.remarks:
Parameters:
e jQuery.Event object.
args
The data with this event.
cell Gets the edited cell's information.
event Event that initiated the cell updating.
handled
Gets or sets value determining whether the developer finalizes editing of the cell manually. The default value is false which means that the widget will try to finalize editing of the cell automatically. If the developer provides a custom editing front end then this property must be set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.OnClientAfterCellUpdate
member.summary: A function called after a cell has been updated.
member.remarks:
Parameters:
e jQuery.Event object.
args
The data with this event.
cell Gets the edited cell's information.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.OnClientBeforeCellEdit
member.summary: A function called before a cell enters edit mode. Cancellable.
member.remarks:
Parameters:
e jQuery.Event object.
args
The data with this event.
cell Information about the cell to be edited.
event Event initiated cell editing.
handled
Gets or sets a value determining whether developer initiates cell editor(s) manually. The default value is false which means that widget will trying to provide editing control automatically. If cells contain custom controls or if developer wants to provide a custom editing front end then he must set this property to true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.OnClientBeforeCellUpdate
member.summary: A function called before a cell is updated.
member.remarks:
Parameters:
e jQuery.Event object.
args
The data with this event.
cell Gets information of the edited cell.
value
Returns the new cell value. If the property value is not changed the widget will try to extract the new cell value automatically. If the developer provides custom editing front end then the new cell value must be returned within this property.

e jQuery.Event object.
args

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowClientEditing
member.summary: A value indicating whether client editing is enabled.
member.value: The default value is False.

remarks.para: In client-side editing mode underlying dataset can be automatically updated only if the control is bound to DataSource control. Otherwise developer should implement dataset update using , and event handlers.
Note: only visible data are available on the client, hence after refresh values of the hidden columns used in UPDATE statement can be set to NULL.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowCustomContent
member.summary: Infrastructure.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.AllowCustomPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether custom paging is enabled.
member.value: The default value is False.

remarks.para: Set this property to True to enable custom paging.

Paging allows you to display the contents of the component in page segments. To enable custom paging, set both the and AllowCustomPaging properties to True. Next, provide code to handle the event. Create a data source that contains the data to display on a single page and then use the DataBind() method to bind the data to the component.

Because only a segment of the data is loaded, you must set the property to the total number of items in the component. This allows the control to determine the total number of pages needed to display every item in the component. This property is normally programmatically set once the total number of items in the component is determined.

When paging is enabled with the AllowCustomPaging property set to False, the component assumes that the data source contains all the items to be displayed. The component calculates the indexes of the items on the displayed page based on the page index, specified by the property, and the number of items on a page, specified by the property.

When the AllowCustomPaging property is set to True, the component assumes that the data source only contains the items as determined by the property. All items up to the number of items specified by the property are displayed.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1GridView.ResetScrollState
member.summary: Resets the virtual scrolling state of the grid view.

remarks.para: The scroll state stores the client scroll position if the virtual scrolling is enabled. When the data source is changed on postback, if the new data source items count does not cover the scroll position, there's no data row be rendered. It may cause the data row does not align with the column header.
Call this method to reset the scroll state, to force the grid view renders the first data row.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1GridView.C1BoundField.DataFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that specifies the display format for items in the column.
member.value: This property is used to provide a custom format for the items in the column.

remarks.para: Note: Formatting of values is done on the client-side using globalize.min.js library. Use formatting patterns supported by that library, for more information on the library please check https://github.com/jquery/globalize
Examples:

para.ul:
"n" - displays numeric values in number format.
"d" - displays numeric values in decimal format.
"d" - displays date values in short date format.///
"p" - displays numeric values in percentage format.
"c" - displays numeric values in currency format.

member.summary: The main Web control used for entering and editing information of any data type in a text form.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the control automatically converts to the proper format according to the format setting.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to treat the wrapped lines as one line or multiple lines when counting the lines count.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Input.C1InputText.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string that defines the type of text allowed for input in the control.
member.remarks: The following key words are supported. DBCS Keywords: Upper case DBCS alphabet (A-Z). Lower case DBCS alphabet (a-z). DBCS Katakana. DBCS Numbers (0-9). DBCS numbers and number related symbols (0-9, +-$%\,.). DBCS symbols. Hiragana. All DBCS characters without Space. SBCS Keywords: A Upper case alphabet (A-Z). a Lower case alphabet (a-z). K Katakana. 9 Numbers (0-9). # Numbers and number related symbols (0-9, +-$%\,.). @ Symbols. H All SBCS characters without Space. ^ Any character not included in the specified format. \ Escape character. For example, format = '', then the wijinputtext can only input the upper case DBCS alphabet. If you input the SBCS 'k', then it will be automatic conver to DBCS '' if the autoConvert is true, But if the autoConvert is false, you can't input 'k'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Input.C1InputDate.DateFormat
member.summary: Determines the format pattern used to display the date value.
member.remarks:
C1InputDate supports two types of formats: Standard Format and Custom Format.
A standard date and time format string uses a single format specifier to define the text representation of a date and time value.
Possible values for Standard Format are: "d": ShortDatePattern "D": LongDatePattern "f": Full date and time (long date and short time) "F": FullDateTimePattern "g": General (short date and short time) "G": General (short date and long time) "m": MonthDayPattern "M": monthDayPattern "r": RFC1123Pattern "R": RFC1123Pattern "s": SortableDateTimePattern "t": shortTimePattern "T": LongTimePattern "u": UniversalSortableDateTimePattern "U": Full date and time (long date and long time) using universal time "y": YearMonthPattern "Y": yearMonthPattern
Any date and time format string that contains more than one character, including white space, is interpreted as a custom date and time format string. For example: "mmm-dd-yyyy", "mmmm d, yyyy", "mm/dd/yyyy", "d-mmm-yyyy", "ddd, mmmm dd, yyyy" etc.
Below are the custom date and time format specifiers:
"d": The day of the month, from 1 through 31. "dd": The day of the month, from 01 through 31. "ddd": The abbreviated name of the day of the week. "dddd": The full name of the day of the week. "m": The minute, from 0 through 59. "mm": The minute, from 00 through 59. "M": The month, from 1 through 12. "MM": The month, from 01 through 12. "MMM": The abbreviated name of the month. "MMMM": The full name of the month. "y": The year, from 0 to 99. "yy": The year, from 00 to 99 "yyy": The year, with a minimum of three digits. "yyyy": The year as a four-digit number "h": The hour, using a 12-hour clock from 1 to 12. "hh": The hour, using a 12-hour clock from 01 to 12. "H": The hour, using a 24-hour clock from 0 to 23. "HH": The hour, using a 24-hour clock from 00 to 23. "s": The second, from 0 through 59. "ss": The second, from 00 through 59. "t": The first character of the AM/PM designator. "tt": The AM/PM designator.

member.summary: Determines the format pattern used to display the date value.
member.remarks:
C1InputDate supports two types of formats: Standard Format and Custom Format.
A standard date and time format string uses a single format specifier to define the text representation of a date and time value.
Possible values for Standard Format are: "d": ShortDatePattern "D": LongDatePattern "f": Full date and time (long date and short time) "F": FullDateTimePattern "g": General (short date and short time) "G": General (short date and long time) "m": MonthDayPattern "M": monthDayPattern "r": RFC1123Pattern "R": RFC1123Pattern "s": SortableDateTimePattern "t": shortTimePattern "T": LongTimePattern "u": UniversalSortableDateTimePattern "U": Full date and time (long date and long time) using universal time "y": YearMonthPattern "Y": yearMonthPattern
Any date and time format string that contains more than one character, including white space, is interpreted as a custom date and time format string. For example: "mmm-dd-yyyy", "mmmm d, yyyy", "mm/dd/yyyy", "d-mmm-yyyy", "ddd, mmmm dd, yyyy" etc.
Below are the custom date and time format specifiers:
"d": The day of the month, from 1 through 31. "dd": The day of the month, from 01 through 31. "ddd": The abbreviated name of the day of the week. "dddd": The full name of the day of the week. "m": The minute, from 0 through 59. "mm": The minute, from 00 through 59. "M": The month, from 1 through 12. "MM": The month, from 01 through 12. "MMM": The abbreviated name of the month. "tt": The AM/PM designator.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Input.C1InputDate.Hour12As0
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of hours that can be entered in the control.
member.value: One of the bool enumeration values. The default is false

remarks.para: This proprety determines the range of hours that can be entered or displayed when the format expression specified by the or the properties describe 12-hour format -- the "tt" and the "HH" keywords included.
If set this property to false, the control sets the range for the hour field from 1 - 12. If set to true the range is set to 0 - 11.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Input.C1InputDate.MidnightAs0
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to express midnight as 24:00.
member.value: false if expressed as 24 o'clock (24:00:00); otherwise, true expressed as 0 o'clock (00:00:00). The default is true.

remarks.para: The MidnightAs24 property effects the property when the property is set to the 24-hour format ("HH:mm:ss").

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Input.C1InputDate.ForceMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to force the month not be changed on typing the year and month if the day exceeds the max days of current month.
member.remarks:
When typing the year and month field, the day may exceeds the max days in current month. The default behavior is as following:
1) If the original day is the last day of the original month, set the day to the last day of the new month.
2) Otherwise, keep the origina day. If the day exceeds last day of the current month, increase the month. (it's done by the standard JavaScript.)
Set this property to true will change to the following behavior:
1) Keep the day if it's valid for the new month.
2) Set the day to the latest day of the new month, if the original day exceeds the last day.
For example, for current date 1997-01-29, set the month to 2.
1) ForceMonth=false, the new date will be 1997-03-01;
2) ForceMonth=true, the new date will be 1997-02-28.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Input.C1InputMask
member.summary: The main Web control used for entering and editing information of any data type in a text form. Supports data formatting, edit mask, data validation and other features. Supports formatted and masked editing of all data types, including additional functionality. Apart from being the main data editor control, C1InputMask also serves as the base class for specialized controls such as C1DateInput and C1NumericInput.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template for the content area of the control.
member.remarks:
Use the ContentTemplate property to control the contents of the dialog window.
To specify a template for the dialog, reset the property, place the <ContentTemplate> tags between the opening and closing tags of the control. You can then list the contents of the template between the opening and closing <ContentTemplate> tags.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Expander.C1Expander.AllowExpand
member.summary: Determines if the widget can expand. Set this option to false if you want to disable collapse/expand ability.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Expander.C1Expander.Animated
member.summary: Determines the animation easing effect; set this option to false in order to disable animation. Additional options that are available for the animation function include: expand - value of true indicates that content element must be expanded. horizontal - value of true indicates that expander is horizontally orientated (when expandDirection is left or right). content - jQuery object that contains content element to be expanded or collapsed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Expander.C1Expander.ContentUrl

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Expander.C1Expander.Expanded
member.summary: Determines the visibility state of the content panel. If true, the content element is visible.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Expander.C1Expander.ExpandDirection
member.summary: Determines the content expand direction. Available values are top, right, bottom, and left.

South The label is aligned at the bottom of the progress bar. Running The label is aligned with the edge of the progress bar.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ProgressBar.C1ProgressBar.LabelFormatString
member.summary: The remarks need to be spaced with paragraph marks. They are currently running together: The available formats are as follows: {0} or {ProgressValue} Expresses the current progress value. {1} or {PercentProgress} Expresses the current percent of the progress bar. {2} or {RemainingProgress} Expresses the remaining progress of the progress bar. {3} or {PercentageRemaining} Expresses the remaining percent of the progress bar. {4} or {Min} Expresses the minimum value of the progress bar. {5} or {Max} Expresses the maximum value of the progress bar.

member.summary: A value indicates whether to slide handle smoothly when user click outside handle on the bar.

member.summary: A value indicates the maximum value of the slider.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Slider.C1Slider.Min
member.summary: A value indicates the minimum value of the slider.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Slider.C1Slider.Step
member.summary: A value indicates the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between min and max. The full specified value range of the slider (max - min) needs to be evenly divisible by the step.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Slider.C1Slider.Range
member.summary: If the option value set to true, the slider will detect if you have two handles and create a styleable range element between these two. Two other possible values are 'min' and 'max'. A min range goes from the slider min to one handle. A max range goes from one handle to the slider max.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Slider.C1Slider.Value
member.summary: A value indicates the value of the slider, if there's only one handle. If there is more than one handle, determines the value of the first handle.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Slider.C1Slider.Values
member.summary: This option can be used to specify multiple handles. If range is set to true, the length of 'values' should be 2.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Slider.C1Slider.Orientation
member.summary: A value indicates whether the slider has the min at the left, the max at the right or the min at the bottom, the max at the top. Possible values: 'horizontal', 'vertical'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Slider.C1Slider.DragFill
member.summary: A value determines whether the fill may be dragged between the buttons.
