member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BaseStateManager.TrackViewState
member.summary: Instructs the server control to track changes to its view state.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase
member.summary: Class to be used as base for the wijmo extenders target controls.
Class to be used as base for the wijmo target controls.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that represents a Span HTML tag.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.IsDesignMode
member.summary: A value that indicates whether the control is in design mode.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.Theme
member.summary: Name of the theme that will be used to style the widgets. Available embedded themes include: aristo, midnight, and ui-lightness. Note that only one theme can be used for the whole page at one time. Please make sure that all widget extenders have the same Theme value.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.UseCDN
member.summary: Determines whether the widget extender must load client resources from CDN (Content Delivery Network) path given by property CDNPath.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.CDNPath
member.summary: Content Delivery Network path.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.CDNDependencyPaths
member.summary: A string array value specifies all css/js references that wijmo control depends on.
member.remarks: Using this property, user can specify the CDN dependencies(such as jQuery, jQuery UI, jQuery mobile, bootstrap). If some dependencies are set in this property, wijmo controls will find dependencies path in this property. If found, use the path to load dependency, otherwise, use the default CDN path. For example, if user wants to specify the dependencies of jQuery and jQuery UI, he can set the value like this: ["http://ajax.aspnetcdn.com/ajax/jQuery/jquery-1.11.1.min.js", "http://ajax.aspnetcdn.com/ajax/jquery.ui/1.11.1/jquery-ui.js"]

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.WijmoCssAdapter
member.summary: Indicates the control applies the theme of JQuery UI or Bootstrap.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.WijmoControlMode
member.summary: A value that indicates mode of the control, whether it is a mobile or web control. Note that only one value can be used for the whole website or project.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.ThemeSwatch
member.summary: A value that indicates the theme swatch of the control, this property only works when WijmoControlMode property is Mobile.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Web server control is enabled.
member.returns: true if control is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.EnableCombinedJavaScripts
member.summary: Enable JavaScripts files combined into one file. In order to combined enabled, you must register the WijmoHttpHandler in web.config.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1TargetControlBase.EnableConditionalDependencies
member.summary: A value indicates whether to register the dependency resources according to the control's property settings.
member.remarks: This property is enabled only when EnableCombinedJavaScripts is set to true.

member.summary: IsEnabled status

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a server control is rendered as UI on the page.
member.remarks: Note that a server control is created and invisible if DisplayVisible is set to false.

member.summary: Class to be used as base for the wijmo extenders target controls.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that represents a Span HTML tag.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.IsDesignMode
member.summary: A value that indicates whether the control is in design mode.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.Theme
member.summary: Name of the theme that will be used to style the widgets. Available embedded themes include: aristo, midnight, and ui-lightness. Note that only one theme can be used for the whole page at one time. Please make sure that all widget extenders have the same Theme value.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.UseCDN
member.summary: Determines whether the widget extender must load client resources from CDN (Content Delivery Network) path given by property CDNPath.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.CDNPath
member.summary: Content Delivery Network path.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.CDNDependencyPaths
member.summary: A string array value specifies all css/js references that wijmo control depends on.
member.remarks: Using this property, user can specify the CDN dependencies(such as jQuery, jQuery UI, jQuery mobile, bootstrap). If some dependencies are set in this property, wijmo controls will find dependencies path in this property. If found, use the path to load dependency, otherwise, use the default CDN path. For example, if user wants to specify the dependencies of jQuery and jQuery UI, he can set the value like this: ["http://ajax.aspnetcdn.com/ajax/jQuery/jquery-1.11.1.min.js", "http://ajax.aspnetcdn.com/ajax/jquery.ui/1.11.1/jquery-ui.js"]

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.WijmoCssAdapter
member.summary: Indicates the control applies the theme of JQuery UI or Bootstrap.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.WijmoControlMode
member.summary: A value that indicates mode of the control, whether it is a mobile or web control. Note that only one value can be used for the whole website or project.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.ThemeSwatch
member.summary: A value that indicates the theme swatch of the control, this property only works when WijmoControlMode property is Mobile.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Web server control is enabled.
member.returns: true if control is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.EnableCombinedJavaScripts
member.summary: Enable JavaScripts files combined into one file. In order to combined enabled, you must register the WijmoHttpHandler in web.config.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.Base.C1TargetCompositeControlBase.EnableConditionalDependencies
member.summary: A value indicates whether to register the dependency resources according to the control's property settings.
member.remarks: This property is enabled only when EnableCombinedJavaScripts is set to true.

member.summary: IsEnabled status

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a server control is rendered as UI on the page.
member.remarks: Note that a server control is created and invisible if DisplayVisible is set to false.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.Delay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds the Autocomplete waits after a keystroke to activate itself. A zero-delay makes sense for local data (more responsive), but can produce a lot of load for remote data, while being less responsive. Reference: http://jqueryui.com/demos/autocomplete/#delay

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.MinLength
member.summary: The minimum number of characters a user has to type before the Autocomplete activates. Zero is useful for local data with just a few items. Should be increased when there are a lot of items, where a single character would match a few thousand items. Reference: http://jqueryui.com/demos/autocomplete/#minLength

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.Position
member.summary: Identifies the position of the Autocomplete widget in relation to the associated input element. The "of" option defaults to the input element, but you can specify another element to position against. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options. Reference: http://jqueryui.com/demos/autocomplete/#position

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.Source
member.summary: Defines the data to use, must be specified. See Overview section for more details, and look at the various demos. Reference: http://jqueryui.com/demos/autocomplete/#source

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientCreate
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called when autocomplete is created.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientSearch
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called Before a request (source-option) is started, after minLength and delay are met. Can be canceled (return false), then no request will be started and no items suggested.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientOpen
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called when the suggestion menu is opened.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientClose
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called when the list is hidden - doesn't have to occur together with a change.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientFocus
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called before focus is moved to an item (not selecting), ui.item refers to the focused item. The default action of focus is to replace the text field's value with the value of the focused item, though only if the focus event was triggered by a keyboard interaction. Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu item from being focused.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientSelect
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called when an item is selected from the menu; ui.item refers to the selected item. The default action of select is to replace the text field's value with the value of the selected item. Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu from closing.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientChange
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called when the field is blurred, if the value has changed; ui.item refers to the selected item.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1AutoComplete.C1AutoComplete.OnClientResponse
member.summary: The name of the function which will be called when a search completes, even if the menu will not be shown because there are no results or the Autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the type of barcode to be generated by the C1BarCode control.

remarks.para: The enumeration represents the different types of barcode that can be generated by the control.
Some types of barcode can be used to represent alphanumeric values, others can only represent numeric values.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.Code39
member.summary: Code 39 is an alpha-numeric encoding also known as 3 of 9 and LOGMARS. This was the first alphanumeric symbology developed, and is one of the most widely used encodings.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.Code93
member.summary: Code 93 is an alpha-numeric encoding that is slightly denser than code 39.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.Code128
member.summary: Code 128 is a very high density alpha-numeric bar code. It will use the least amount of space of any current 1-D symbology for symbols with 6 characters or more.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.CodeI2of5
member.summary: Code I2of5 is a numeric encoding. The symbol can be as long as necessary to store the encoded data.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar may encode 16 different characters (0 through 9 plus -$:/.+), plus an additional 4 start/stop characters (A through D). Codabar is used by some US blood banks, photo labs, and on FedEx air bills.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.PostNet
member.summary: PostNet is a numeric encoding used by the US postal service. It differs from most others in that it is based on the height of the bars rather than on their width.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.Ean13
member.summary: EAN-13 was implemented by the International Article Numbering Association (EAN) in Europe. EAN-13 encodes a 12-digit code that consists of a 2 digit system code followed by a 5 digit manufacturer code and a 5-digit product code. The 12-digit code is followed by a checksum digit (automatically added by the control).

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.Ean8
member.summary: EAN-8 provides a short barcode for small packages. It encodes a 7-digit code that consists of a 2 or 3 digit system code followed by a 4 or 5 digit product code. The 7-digit code is followed by a checksum digit (automatically added by the control).

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoCodeTypeEnum.UpcA
member.summary: UPC-A is the common encoding you will find on virtually every consumer good on the shelves of your local supermarket, as well as books, magazines, and newspapers. It is similar to EAN-13, and encodes 11 digits of numeric data along with a trailing check digit. The first digit determines the number system, followed by a 5-digit manufacturer code, a 5-digit product code, and the check digit.

summary.para: UPC-E is a variation of UPC-A which allows for a more compact barcode by eliminating "extra" zeros. Since the resulting UPC-E barcode is about half the size as an UPC-A barcode, it is generally used on products with very small packaging.
When using the UpcE encoding, set the Text property to an 11-digit string as if you were using the UpcA encoding.

Note that not all UpcA codes can be encoded in UpcE. If the manufacturer code ends with "000", "100", or "200", the product number must be <= 900. If the manufacturer code ends with "00" but not with "100", "200", or "300", then the product number must be <= 90. If the manufacturer code ends with "0" but not with "00", then the product number must be <= 9. If the manufacturer code does not end with "0", then the product number must be between 5 and 9.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoBarDirectionEnum
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the barcode

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoBarDirectionEnum.Normal
member.summary: The barcode is rendered in the horizontal direction.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoBarDirectionEnum.Up
member.summary: The barcode is rendered from the bottom up.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.WijmoBarDirectionEnum.Down
member.summary: The barcode is rendered from the top down.

member.summary: BarCode Property: Gets or sets the width of the narrow bars in screen pixels.
member.remarks: By default, narrow bars are one screen pixel wide (1/96") and wide bars are two pixels wide (1/96"). You should never have to change these values, they are exposed only in case you need to make adjustments for special barcode reader hardware.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1BarCode.C1BarCode.EncodingException
member.summary: Gets the that prevented the from being encoded.

remarks.para: Most encodings have limitations that determine what type of text it can represent. For example, some are numeric-only and some require text of a specific length.
If the value of the property cannot be represented using the current , then no bar code will be generated and the control will remain blank.
In this case, the EncodingException property returns details about the exception that prevented the bar code from being generated.

Rename - Rename the specified path defined in sourcePaths to the new path defined in path. Move - Move the specified paths defined in sourcePaths to the path. Delete - Invalid. GetHostUri - Invalid.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1VirtualLayer.Slices
member.summary: Gets a collection of which specifies how the map is partitioned for virtualization.
member.remarks: Each slice defines a set of regions this virtual layer will get items form when needed. The minimum zoom of a slice is the value value of it's property, while the maximum zoom is the value from the property of the next slice. Each slice divides the map in a uniform grid of regions according to the current projection.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps
member.summary: Represents the C1Maps control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps.Center
member.summary: Gets or sets the center of this map in geographic coordinates.
member.remarks: The default value is (0,0).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps.Zoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom factor of this map.
member.remarks: The default value is 1. The minimum zoom factor is 1. An increment of 1 in the zoom factor doubles the map resolution.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps.ShowTools
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the default tools are shown.
member.remarks: The default value is true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps.ZoomingSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the speed with which approaches target zoom.
member.remarks: The default value is 0.3. The value should be between 0 and 1. A value of 1 indicates that Zoom instantly changes to target zoom. When clicking the zoom in/zoom out buttons or moving mouse wheel or double-clicking the map tiles or pressing "+/-" key, the maps should zoom in/zoom out 1 times which is called target zoom here. The property is used to specify the zooming speed from current size to the target zoom.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps.PanningSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the speed with which approaches target center.
member.remarks: The default value is 0.3. The value should be between 0 and 1. A value of 1 indicates that Center instantly changes to target center. When clicking the pan direction buttions or pressing direction keys, the maps should offset a certain distance which is called target center here. The property is used to specify the panning speed from current center to the target center.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps.CustomSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the used as source for the custom map tiles.
member.remarks: This property works only when is set to .

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1Maps.C1Maps.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the used as source for the base map tiles.
member.remarks: The default value is . If the source is set to , no map tiles are shown.

members.member:
The util for immporting the KML and KMZ files.
///
KML is a popular XML-based language used for representing geographic information.
There are several tools available for creating, editing, and viewing KML files.
There are also several sources of free and commercial KML and KMZ files, including for example www.geocommons.com and www.esri.com.
KMZ is also a popular format which consists of zipped KML, and is also supported by the class. The class has static methods that create collections of vector objects from the supplied KML or KMZ source. These objects can then be added to a and placed on the map.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode
member.summary: Represents a C1QRCode in an ASP.NET Web page.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for the control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color for the control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is encoded as a QR code image.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.CodeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the "version" of QR code to generate.

remarks.para: The QR specification includes 40 "versions" of QR codes. Higher versions consume more space and are able to encode more information.
The control can generate QR codes versions one through ten only, which allow encoding up to 652 digits, or 395 alphanumeric characters, or 271 bytes.
Set the property to zero (the default value) to automatically use the most compact version able to render the content specified in the property.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.ErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the error correction level used to create the QR code.

remarks.para: Higher levels of error correction add more redundant information to the QR code, making it more resistant to damage. Higher levels of error correction also reduce the amount of data that can be encoded in a given area.
The default value for this property is the lowest level, which produces the most compact QR codes.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to translate the content in the property into binary values to be encoded in the QR code.

remarks.para: More flexible encodings have lower capacity. The control can encode up to 652 digits, or 395 alphanumeric characters, or 271 bytes.
The default value for this property is , which causes the control to automatically select the most compact encoding that can be used based on the content specified in the property.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.SymbolSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size, in pixels, of the symbols used to build the QR image.

remarks.para: Larger values will result in larger images which consume more space but may be easier to for some scanners to read.
The default symbol size is three pixels, which usually represents a good compromise between size and readability.
This property must be set to values between 2 and 10.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to determine whether control should reset its size according to the QR code image.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.Image
member.summary: Gets the image of the QR code.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.ImageUrl
member.summary: Get a Base64 string which is a conversion of the QR code image. Users can set this result into an ASP.net Image control's "ImageUrl" property or a HTML Image element's "Src" attribute to show the QR code image manually.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1QRCode.C1QRCode.EncodingException
member.summary: Gets the that prevented the from being encoded.

remarks.para: The control can be used to encode up to 652 digits, or 395 alphanumeric characters (uppercase only), or 271 bytes.

If these limits are exceeded, or if any of the control properties is set to values that prevent the content of the property from being encoded, the control remains blank, and the property contains details that explain why the code could not be generated.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.C1ReportViewer.Cache
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that controls how reports are cached on the server.

remarks.para: The report cache is one of the most powerful features in the control. By default, every time the control renders a report, it compresses the resulting Html stream and stores it in the object. If the same report is requested again, the control simply fetches it back from the cache and sends it directly to the client. This results in fast response times and consumes little memory (because the reports are cached in compressed form).

The control is smart enough to detect changes to the report definition and keep track of different versions in the cache. It also detects changes to the report definition file and discards old reports from the cache.
The cache object itself is provided by the ASP.NET framework ( property), and can be set up to match your server configuration, including Web Farm scenarios.
The object allows you to disable the cache, specify time out values, and add dependencies (to data source files for example).

Logically, this is the constructor - the only place where a new instance of CachedDocument is created.
This method is called from within a static lock (typeof(CachedDocument)).
Inserts a document into the cache. Adding pages is handled in 2 different ways depending on whether the Pages array is currently empty or not. If it is not empty, the document is considered to be generated, pages are added and never checked for updates. If currently there are no pages, document's page added/changed events are subscribed to, and pages are only added on those events.

member.summary:
Thread top method.
Adds pages to a zip in a separate thread. After each page is added, the file becomes available for reading by other threads. This method is used when the viewer starts with a generated document, and all pages are already available.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.GenerateDoc.GeneratingDocInfo.ToZipQueue
member.summary:
This is the queue of cache-ready pages waiting to be put into the page zip. The queue is created by the C1PrintDocument page (added, changed) and end event handlers. Pages are drawn in the same thread as the document is generated, and then put into this queue to be saved to the page zip. Because page zip saving may be slow, using a separate thread for that should speed things up as document generation won't have to wait for zip updates.
NULL element closes the queue and exits page zip updating thread.
Use lock(ToZipQueue) to access the queue.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.GenerateDoc.GeneratingDocInfo.ToZipQueueWaitHandle
member.summary: Used by the page zip updating thread to wait for new pages to be added to the queue.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.DocumentStatus.exportFormats
member.summary:
Export formats available for current document. The list is a sequence of pairs: export format description/default extension for that format.
The description should uniquely identify the format within the list.
The extension must be lowercase and should not include the dot (e.g. "pdf").
This member contains data only when the document is not generating ( is false).

member.summary: The height of the text run, in pixels.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.TextRunMarkup.p
member.summary: Array containing X coordinates of words' first chars, relative to the left bound of the text run. May be null or have 0 elements. If the first element is present, it would normally contain 0 i.e. the X coordinate of the first char of the first word in the text run.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.TextRunMarkup.ix
member.summary: Array containing 0-based indices of words' first chars into the "text" string. If the "p" array is null or empty, this array must also be null or empty. If the "p" array is not empty, and this array has exactly one element "-1", the "p" array is assumed to contain coordinates of all individual chars in "text". In all other cases, this array must have the same number of elements as the "p" array, and must contain indices into "text" string of subsequent words' first chars. In that case the first element of this array must contain "0" (index of the first char of the first word in the text run). The length of a word is determined by the starting indices of that and next word.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.TextRunMarkup.text
member.summary: The text of the text run. May not contain line breaks.

Action examples: "http://google.com'", url to external page that will be opened in current window (user can use ctrl+click in order to open hyperlink in the new window) "javascript:some_javascript code", e.g. "javascript:alert('hello world')" "exec:somemethod(parame, parame2)", executes C1ReportViewer method, e.g. "exec:exportToFile('Adobe PDF','pdf')" "moveto:p,i", where p - page index, i - index of the TextRunMarkup within tr array of the page given by index p , report view will be scrolled to given place", e.g. "javascript:alert('moveto:5,10')" todo: add moveTo method for the C1ReportViewer client side object and use it along with exec action

member.name: T:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.ReportCache
member.summary: Reports cache implementation (controlled by web report's Cache property or by service).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.ReportCache.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the control should store rendered reports in the cache.
member.value: true if enabled; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property is set to true by default, allowing the to use the object to store frequently used reports. This enhances performance significantly, but it does use some server resources.

If you want to reduce the memory requirements on the server, setting the property to false will cause the control not to use the cache. Reports will be rendered every time they are requested, and memory usage will be reduced at the expense of more data access and processing time needed to create the reports multiple times.
In general, you should only turn the cache off if you are rendering a custom report that probably won't be requested again in the next few hours.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.ReportCache.Expiration
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minutes that elapse before reports are discarded from the cache.

remarks.para: The default value for this property is 30, causing reports to be stored in the cache for 30 minutes before they are discarded. You can use the property to determine whether this is an absolute or a "sliding" limit (meaning the interval is reset every time the report in the cache is reused).
The amount of time reports remain in the cache is also affected by file dependencies. By default, changes in the report definition file cause cached reports to be discarded.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.ReportCache.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the cost of reports relative to other objects in the cache.

remarks.para: If your application stores many types of object in the cache, you may want to set the property to reflect the relative cost of each type of item. For example, you may be generating technical diagrams that take a long time to create, and should have a higher cache priority than simple reports. Or you may be caching customer information that is easy to retrieve from the database and should have a lower priority.
For more details on this property, and a list of valid settings, see the method in the .NET framework documentation.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.ReportCache.ShareBetweenSessions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether cached reports and documents are shared between different sessions. The default value is true, which means that different browser sessions will be able to access the same cached report or document. Set to false to prevent such sharing.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.ReportCache.GetShareBetweenSessions
member.summary: This method is for internal use.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Controls.C1ReportViewer.ReportService.ReportCache.Sliding
member.summary: Specifies whether the expiration timer should be reset when reports are retrieved from the cache.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is true, meaning that the expiration time is resets when reports are retrieved from the cache.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.MappingCollectionBase`1.IdMapping
member.summary: Returns object for the property. If the storage object is bound to a data source via its DataSource property, the properties of this object allow the property to be bound to the appropriate field in the data source.
member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.

member.name: T:C1.C1Schedule.BaseStorage`2
member.summary: The is the base generic component for all storages in C1Schedule object model. Represents a storage of objects derived from . This component implements methods of operations over the collections of objects. It allows the collection to be populated programmatically or automatically by retrieving data from the data source which is specified by the DataSource and DataMember properties. It allows mapping of data source fields to the object properties.
member.typeparam: The type of the objects which will be stored in the storage. It should be derived from the class and have the default parameter-less constructor.
The type of the collection which will be used for mapping. It should be derived from the class and have the default parameter-less constructor.

member.name: T:C1.C1Schedule.C1ScheduleStorage
member.summary: The component handles all data operations for the scheduler control and contains specific data storages for appointments, resources, contacts, owners, labels and statuses, which are used for binding different collections to the data. The component also handles data importing and exporting to other scheduling formats such as binary, iCal, and XML.

member.name: F:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrenceStateEnum.Removed
member.summary: Represents a recurring appointment, which was deleted and now doesn't satisfy the pattern of the recurring series.

member.summary: Gets the reference to the parent object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Action
member.summary: Gets an object for the object. Once this property is first requested, a new object is created and assigned to the property.
member.remarks: The object contains information regarding the type of action to perform as well as the command and parameters to pass to the action. If the action object is enabled, the action will be invoked when the start date and time of the owning object has occurred.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Importance
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the relative importance level for the appointment. Default value is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AllDayEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the current appointment is an All-day appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom information associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is valid only for the lifetime of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.CustomData
member.summary: Gets or sets custom text associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is serialized with other appointment properties. It isn't used by the scheduler, use it to keep your data associated with appointment. This property is serialized into xml and binary formats and it is saved into underlying data source if mapping for Appointment Properties is set. It isn't retained at export/import to iCal format.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Saved
member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment has not been modified since the last save.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the sensitivity level of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Private
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining whether the calendar owner intends to keep the object private.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the subject of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the body of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Conflicts
member.summary: Gets the object representing the list of objects which are in conflict with this particular appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AutoResolvedWinner
member.summary: Gets the value determining if the item is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution.
member.remarks: A value of false does not necessarily indicate that the item is a loser of an automatic conflict resolution. The item should be in conflict with another item. If an item has its Conflicts.Count property greater than zero and if its property is true, it is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution. On the other hand, if the item is in conflict and has its property as false, it is a loser in an automatic conflict resolution.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the start date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: If the property is set to true, then the start date of the appointment is the of the , and the start time of the appointment is 0:00.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.End
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the end date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: The property is usually specified by the and properties, and is always calculated as = + . When setting the property, the property retains its value, and the is changed according to the new value of the property. If the new property's value is less than the property's value, then an exception will be raised.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, or value is equal to the value of property, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsOneDay
member.summary: Gets a value indicating either it is a one day appointment or shares some days.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of the appointment.
member.remarks: At setting this property, if it's value is not equal to the whole number of days, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying where the appointment is going to be.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Reminder
member.summary: Gets the object which is associated with the appointment. To associate an appointment with the reminder, set its property to true. Once this property is set to true, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether a reminder is associated with the appointment. Once this property is set to true, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderTimeBeforeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the interval of time the reminder should occur prior to the start of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderOverrideDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the associated object has non-default settings. True if the reminder overrides the default reminder behavior for the appointment. You must set the property to validate the and the properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderPlaySound
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the reminder should play a sound when it occurs for this appointment or task. The property must be set in order to validate the property. This property is only valid if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSoundFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the path and file name of the sound file to play when the reminder occurs for the appointment. This property is only valid if the and properties are set to true.
member.remarks: The default sound is the system Exclamation sound.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsRecurring
member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment is recurring.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ParentRecurrence
member.summary: Gets the object that defines the recurrence criteria for this object. If this appointment is a not member of a recurrence, or is itself a root appointment, null is returned.
member.remarks: If an appointment is recurring (see the property) it represents an occurrence in the series that is started and defined by a specific pattern appointment. Use the property to obtain the pattern of the current appointment. A pattern appointment can be recognized by its property set to the value. The recurrence information defined by the pattern appointment can be accessed via the property of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.RecurrenceState
member.summary: Gets the value indicating the recurrence state of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the object associated with this appointment.
member.remarks: Labels may be associated with an appointment to effectively group appointments.
This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.LabelStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Resources
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of objects for this appointment. An appointment may be associated with multiple resources.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.ResourceStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Links
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of objects for this appointment. An appointment may be associated with multiple contacts.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.ContactStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.BusyStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the object indicating the busy status of the user for the appointment.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.StatusStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Categories
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of categories assigned to the appointment. Categories may be associated with an appointment to effectively group appointments. An appointment may be associated with multiple categories.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.CategoryStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Owner

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.BeginEdit
member.summary: Prevents the object from being updated until the method is called.
member.remarks: The and methods are designed to implement batch modifications. This allows you to prevent generation of change notifications when changing multiple settings at the same time. To do this enclose the code that changes the properties in calls to these methods. Each call to must be paired with a call to . To ensure that is always called even if an exception occurs, wrap any calls to these methods in a try...finally statement.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.EndEdit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unlocks the object after a call to the method and causes an immediate update.
member.param: The value determining if change notifications can be generated when applying changes.

member.summary: Gets an array of objects representing the key of the .

remarks.para: In the current version, the array always contains a single object. It can be either an or value depending on which one is actually used for binding this data. For example, if you bind AppointmentStorage to the database and set IndexMapping, this property will return an value. If you set IdMapping, this property will return a value.
In future versions working with compound keys might be implemented. In such case this property will return array of objects composing the key.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.RecurrenceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the type of recurrence (daily, monthly, etc.). Default value is RecurrenceTypeEnum.Weekly.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying the interval between occurrences of the recurrence. The property works in conjunction with the property to determine the cycle of the recurrence. The maximum allowable value is 99 for weekly patterns and 999 for daily patterns. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: For example, if the is set to , and the is set to 3, the recurrence will occur every third day.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of each occurrence in the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternStartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end date of the recurrence pattern.
member.remarks: This property is optional but must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If this property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite, and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true. The property must be set before setting .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Occurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. This property allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Instance
member.summary: Get or sets the value specifying the count for which the recurrence pattern is valid for a given interval. This property is only valid for recurrences of the and types and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The default value is WeekOfMonthEnum.First.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfWeekMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the mask for week days on which the recurring appointment occurs. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. Weekly patterns are only valid as the Or of the . The default value is 0.
member.remarks: When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property cannot be set to ; doing so will result in an exception being thrown. When the property is set to or the property is not applicable.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Can be a number from 1 to 12. This property is only valid for recurrence patterns whose property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.NoEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the recurrence pattern is endless. The default value is True.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.summary: Gets the object which holds the list of objects removed from that series of appointments.

member.summary: Gets the value indicating the next time the specified reminder will occur.
member.remarks: The property value changes every time the object's method is executed or when the user clicks the Snooze button.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Reminder.OriginalReminderDate
member.summary: Gets the value specifying the original date and time that the specified reminder is set to occur. It is calculated using the following formula: = - .
member.remarks: This value corresponds to the original date and time value before the method is executed or the user clicks the Snooze button.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Reminder.Snooze(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: The method notifies the scheduler to defer the triggering of a reminder by the specified interval.
member.param: The value specifying the interval of time to wait before displaying the reminder again.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Reminder.Dismiss
member.summary: Dismisses the current object.

member.name: T:C1.C1Schedule.ReminderCollection
member.summary: The is a collection of all objects that represents the reminders for all pending items.
member.remarks: Use the property to get a reference to the Reminders collection. Reminders are created programmatically when a new object is created with a reminder. For example, a reminder is created when an object is created and the property is set to true.

member.name: E:C1.C1Schedule.ReminderCollection.ReminderAdd
member.summary: Occurs after a reminder is added.

member.name: E:C1.C1Schedule.ReminderCollection.ReminderChange
member.summary: Occurs after a reminder has been modified.

member.name: E:C1.C1Schedule.ReminderCollection.ReminderFire
member.summary: Occurs before the reminder is executed.

member.name: E:C1.C1Schedule.ReminderCollection.ReminderSnooze
member.summary: Occurs when a reminder is dismissed using the Snooze button.

member.name: E:C1.C1Schedule.ReminderCollection.ReminderRemove
member.summary: Occurs when a object has been removed from the collection.
member.remarks: A reminder can be removed from the Reminders collection by any of the following means: - The Reminders collection's Remove method. - The Reminder object's Dismiss method. - When the user clicks the Dismiss button. - When a user turns off a meeting reminder from within the associated item. - When a user deletes an item that contains a reminder.

member.summary: The time zone's name during 'standard' time (i.e. not daylight savings).

member.summary: The time zone's name during daylight savings time (DST).

member.summary: Gets the difference, in minutes, between UTC and local time. UTC = local time + bias.

member.summary: Gets the difference, in minutes, between UTC and local time (in daylight savings time). UTC = local time + bias.
